qas.question: Who did The Sun say was not fit to be Prime Minister in 1983?
Which party was The Sun accused of covering maliciously?
Who did The Sun support in the 1984 U.S. presidential election?
How old would Ronald Reagan turn soon after he began his second term as U.S. president?
What did the headline read that was run with Michael Foot's photo?

answers.text: "Do You Really Want This Old Fool To Run Britain?"

context: These years included what was called "spectacularly malicious coverage" of the <a1_0>Labour Party<a1_0/> by The Sun and other newspapers. During the general election of 1983 The Sun ran a front page featuring an unflattering photograph of <a0_0>Michael Foot<a0_0/>, then aged almost 70, claiming he was unfit to be Prime Minister on grounds of his age, appearance and policies, alongside the headline <a4_0>"Do You Really Want This Old Fool To Run Britain?"<a4_0/> A year later, in 1984, The Sun made clear its enthusiastic support for the re-election of <a2_0>Ronald Reagan<a2_0/> as president in the USA. Reagan was two weeks off his <a3_0>74<a3_0/>th birthday when he started his second term, in January 1985.
